title: The Health Care Rationing Commission
description: The Wall Street Journal writes that the most dangerous parts of ObamaCare aren't receiving the scrutiny they deserve, and one of the least examined is a new commission to tell Congress how to control health spending. Democrats are quietly attempting to impose a "global budget" on Medicare, with radical implications for U.S. medicine
cleaned_text: Nov. 15, 2009 10:24 pm ET As usual, the most dangerous parts of ObamaCare aren't receiving the scrutiny they deserve—and one of the least examined is a new commission to tell Congress how to control health spending. Democrats are quietly attempting to impose a "global budget" on Medicare, with radical implications for U.S. medicine. Copyright ©2023 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.
